data.title: Nasher Annual Report 2017
data.meta_site_name: Nasher Museum of Art at Duke University
data.text:
Njideka Akunyili Crosby, Born in Enugu, Nigeria, 1983. “The Beautyful Ones Are Not Yet Born” Might Not Hold True For Much Longer, 2013. Acrylic and transfers on paper, 64 × 82 7/8 inches (162.6 × 210.5 cm). Gift of Marjorie (P’16, P’19, P’19) and Michael Levine (T’84, P’16, P’19, P’19). 2016.21.1

Rev. Howard Finster, Born in Valley Head, Alabama, 1916 – 2001, Gabriel Angel, 1993, Pigments on wood, 9 1/2 x 48 x 1/4 inches (24.1 x 121.9 x 0.6 cm). Gift of Bruce Lineker, T’86, 2016.7.1

Rev. Howard Finster, Born in Valley Head, Alabama, 1916 – 2001, Wipe Rag Art, 1993. Paint on fabric, mounted on wood, 13 x 16 x 1/2 inches (33 x 40.6 x 1.3 cm). Gift of Bruce Lineker, T’86, 2016.7.2

Ed Harris, Born in Tenafly, New Jersey, 1950, Untitled (Pollock Panel), 1999, Acrylic on canvas, 66 x 92 inches (167.6 x 233.7 cm), Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.9

Claude Lawrence, Born in Chicago, Illinois, 1944, Caribbean, 2002. Oil on paper, 30 × 22 1/4 inches (76.2 × 56.5 cm). Gift of E.T. Williams, Jr., and Auldlyn Higgins Williams of New York in memory of Anthony Drexel Duke, Sr., 2016.11.1,

Claude Lawrence, Born in Chicago, Illinois, 1944, Untitled, 2001. Oil on paper, 22 5/8 × 30 inches (57.5 × 76.2 cm). Gift of E.T. Williams, Jr., and Auldlyn Higgins Williams of New York in memory of Anthony Drexel Duke, Sr., 2016.11.2

Claude Lawrence, Born in Chicago, Illinois, 1944, Untitled, 1993. Oil on paper, 22 5/8 × 30 inches (57.5 × 76.2 cm). Gift of E.T. Williams, Jr., and Auldlyn Higgins Williams of New York in memory of Anthony Drexel Duke, Sr., 2016.11.3

Archibald J. Motley, Jr., Born in New Orleans, Louisiana, 1891 – 1981, Hot Rhythm, 1961. Oil on canvas, 39 7/8 × 48 1/4 × 7/8 inches (101.3 × 122.6 × 2.2 cm). Gift of Mara Motley, M.D., and Valerie Gerrard Browne in honor of Professor Richard J. Powell and C.T. Woods‑Powell and in memory of Archie Motley, 2016.24.1

Rev. Benjamin Franklin Perkins, Born in Vernon, Alabama, 1904 – 1993, Home of B. F. Perkins, 1992, Acrylic on canvas, 37 x 27 x 1 inches (94 x 68.6 x 2.5 cm). Gift of Bruce Lineker, T’86, 2016.7.4

Amy Sherald, Born in Columbus, Georgia 1973, Light is easy to love., 2017. Oil on canvas, 54 × 43 inches (137.2 × 109.2 cm). Gift of Jennifer McCracken New and Jason G. New, in honor of Sarah Schroth upon the occasion of our New York City visit, March 2017, 2017.3.1

Henry Taylor, Born in Ventura, California 1958, Hammons meets a hyena on holiday, 2016. Acrylic on canvas, 60 × 84 inches (152.4 × 213.4 cm). Museum purchase with additional funds provided by the Blackburn Endowment and Nasher Annual Fund, 2017.1.1

Torey Thornton, Born in Macon, Georgia, 1990, You Pissed On My Suburban, 2014. 64 7/8 × 82 1/4 inches (164.8 × 208.9 cm). Acrylic, spray paint, oil pastel, nail polish, glitter glue, charcoal, and collage on paper, Gift of Christen (P’15) and Derek Wilson (T’86, B’90, P’15), 2016.23.1

Kehinde Wiley, Born in Los Angeles, California, 1977, St. John the Baptist II, 2006. Oil on canvas, 96 x 72 inches (243.8 x 182.9 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.5.1

Manuel Neri, Born in Sanger, California, 1930, Mujer Pegada Series No. 1 (Cast A/P), 2004. Bronze with oil‑based pigments, 70 × 56 × 10 inches (177.8 × 142.2 × 25.4 cm). Gift of the Manuel Neri Trust, 2016.26.1

Manuel Neri, Born in Sanger, California, 1930, On the Up No. 1, 1989 – 1992. Plaster with mixed media, 69 1/2 × 19 1/4 × 16 1/4 inches (176.5 × 48.9 × 41.3 cm). Gift of the Manuel Neri Trust, 2016.26.2

Manuel Neri, Born in Sanger, California, 1930, Amante Bronze Maquette II (Cast 1/4), 1983 (cast 2013). Bronze with oil‑based pigments, 22 1/4 × 6 1/8 × 5 7/8 inches (56.5 × 15.6 × 14.9 cm). Gift of the Manuel Neri Trust, 2016.26.3

Manuel Neri, Born in Sanger, California, 1930, Sutee Figure II, c. 1956 – 1957. Cloth, gauze, wire, paper, nails, and string on wood base, 13 3/8 × 21 1/2 × 6 inches (34 × 54.6 × 15.2 cm). Gift of the Manuel Neri Trust, 2016.26.4

Gary Simmons, Born in New York, New York, 1964, Erasure Chair, 1989. Felt and wood, 34 x 22 1/2 x 18 inches (86.4 x 57.2 x 45.7 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.31

Berenice Abbott, Born in Springfield, Ohio, 1898 – 1991, Lamport Cotton Export Co., New York, 1935. Vintage gelatin silver contact print, 7 1/4 × 9 3/8 inches (18.4 × 23.8 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.1

Berenice Abbott, Born in Springfield, Ohio, 1898 – 1991, Custom House Statue, Produce Exchange Building, New York, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver contact print, 7 5/8 × 9 1/2 inches (19.4 × 24.1 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.2

Berenice Abbott, Born in Springfield, Ohio, 1898 – 1991, Milk Wagon (Sheffield Farms), 1936. Vintage gelatin silver contact print, 8 × 10 inches (20.3 × 25.4 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.3

Dieter Appelt, Born in Niemegk, Germany, 1935, 10 Variationen aun Zahlensystem der Massai, 1977. Portfolio of 10 photographs, Gelatin silver prints on PE paper, Dimensions variable. Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.3.A – J

Robert Beck, Born in Baltimore, Maryland, 1959, Thirteen Shooters (Mitchell Johnson & Andrew Golden) from the portfolio Thirteen Shooters, 2001. Inkjet pigment prints on paper, Edition 6/6, 51 5/16 x 42 1/16 inches (130.3 x 106.8 cm), 51 1/4 x 42 inches (130.2 x 106.7 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.4.A – B

Ilse Bing, Born in Frankfurt‑am‑Main, Germany, 1899 – 1998, Flags Along the Avenue, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver print, 11 1/4 × 8 3/8 inches (28.6 × 21.3 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.4

Ilse Bing, Born in Frankfurt‑am‑Main, Germany, 1899 – 1998, Haircut, Shave, and Shoeshine, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver print, 11 1/8 × 8 1/8 inches (28.3 × 20.6 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.5

Ilse Bing, Born in Frankfurt‑am‑Main, Germany, 1899 – 1998, Washington Square, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver print, 11 1/8 × 8 inches (28.3 × 20.3 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.6

Ilse Bing, Born in Frankfurt‑am‑Main, Germany, 1899 – 1998, The New York Hotel, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver print, 11 1/8 × 7 1/2 inches (28.3 × 19.1 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.7

Ilse Bing, Born in Frankfurt‑am‑Main, Germany, 1899 – 1998, View of the Chrysler Building, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver print, 11 1/8 × 7 3/8 inches (28.3 × 18.7 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.8

Ilse Bing, Born in Frankfurt‑am‑Main, Germany, 1899 – 1998, Empire State Building, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver print, 11 1/4 × 7 3/8 inches (28.6 × 18.7 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.9

Ilse Bing, Born in Frankfurt‑am‑Main, Germany, 1899 – 1998, Rooftops of Manhattan Looking South, Including Rockefeller Center and the Empire State Building, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver print, 11 1/4 × 8 3/4 inches (28.6 × 22.2 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.10

Ilse Bing, Born in Frankfurt‑am‑Main, Germany, 1899 – 1998, Rockefeller Center Under Construction, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver print, 11 1/8 × 7 1/2 inches (28.3 × 19.1 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.11

Ilse Bing, Born in Frankfurt‑am‑Main, Germany, 1899 – 1998, Carriage and Driver, Central Park, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver print, 11 1/8 × 8 3/4 inches (28.3 × 22.2 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.12

Ilse Bing, Born in Frankfurt‑am‑Main, Germany, 1899 – 1998, Pushcart Vendor Outside J. Ross Diamonds, 1936. Vintage gelatin silver print, 11 1/8 × 8 3/8 inches (28.3 × 21.3 cm). Gift of Meg and Bennett Goodman, 2016.20.13

Christopher Bucklow, Born in Manchester, England in 1957, Untitled (804210796) from the Guest series, 1996. Chromogenic print face-mounted to Plexiglas, Edition 154/400, 19 3/4 x 16 x 3/16 inches (50.2 x 40.6 x 0.5 cm). Gift of Bruce Lineker, T’86, 2017.6.1

William Eggleston, Born in Memphis, Tennessee, 1939, Untitled from the series The Democratic Forest, c. 1983 – 1986. Pigment print, Edition 4/5, 20 3/4 × 29 1/8 × 1 3/4 inches (52.7 × 74 × 4.4 cm). Gift of Jennifer McCracken New and Jason G. New, in honor of Kristine Stiles, with gratitude for her inestimable inspiration, 2017.2.1

David Hammons, Born in Springfield, Illinois, 1943, Money Tree, 1992. Sepia print, 19 3/4 x 16 inches (50.2 x 40.6 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.7

Lyle Ashton Harris, Born in the Bronx, New York, 1965, Untitled (Oak Bluffs) from the series The Watering Hole, 1996. Duraflex photograph, Edition 2/6, 48 x 44 inches (121.9 x 111.8 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.10

Lyle Ashton Harris, Born in the Bronx, New York, 1965, Brotherhood, Crossroads and Etc.Polaroid, unique, 30 3/4 x 21 3/4 inches (78.1 x 55.2 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.11

Lyle Ashton Harris, Born in the Bronx, New York, 1965, Maine # 1, 1987. Gelatin silver print, Edition 5/5, 11 3/8 x 7 1/2 inches (28.9 x 19.1 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, in honor of Raymond D. Nasher, 2017.4.12

Lyle Ashton Harris, Born in the Bronx, New York, 1965, Maine # 2, 1987. Gelatin silver print, Edition 5/5, 12 3/8 x 6 7/8 inches (31.4 x 17.5 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, in honor of Raymond D. Nasher, 2017.4.13

Lyle Ashton Harris, Born in the Bronx, New York, 1965, Untitled (Alchemy Procession), 1998. Duraflex photograph, 30 x 40 inches (76.2 x 101.6 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, in honor of Raymond D. Nasher, 2017.4.14

Clarence John Laughlin, Born in Lake Charles, Louisiana, 1905 – 1985, The Language of Light. 1952, Gelatin silver print, 10 1/4 × 13 3/4 inches (26 × 34.9 cm). Gift of James and Jane Finch, 2016.10.1

William Leavitt, Born in Washington, D.C., 1941, Sunset & Vine, n.d. Black and white photograph, 3 1/4 x 19 15/16 inches (8.3 x 50.6 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.20

Paul McCarthy, Born in Salt Lake City, Utah, 1945, Damon McCarthy, Born in Los Angeles, California, 1973, Pirate Party Photograph Portfolio, 2005. Portfolio of 79 photographs, Chromogenic prints, Edition 5/10, Dimensions variable. Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.23.1 – 79

Zwelethu Mthethwa, Born in Durban, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa, 1960, Untitled from Interior Series #9, 2002 (printed 2006). Chromogenic print mounted on aluminum, 70 1/2 x 95 inches (179.1 x 241.3 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.37

Brittany Nelson, Born in Great Falls, Montana, 1984, Monolith #2, 2016. Tintype photograph on powder coated formed aluminum, 24 × 20 × 4 1/2 inches (61 × 50.8 × 11.4 cm). Gift of the Estate of Theo Westenberger, 2016.12.1

The PRC Portfolio, printed 2008, Portfolio of 16 photographs by Barbara Bosworth, Jim Dow, Lalla Essaydi, Ralph Gibson, Frank Gohlke, Emmet Gowin, David Hilliard, Henry Horenstein, Jocelyn Lee, Laura McPhee, Susan Meiselas, Arno Rafael Minkkinen, Abelardo Morell, Robert and Shana ParkeHarrison, Patti Smith, and Sage Sohier. Mediums variable, Dimensions variable. Gift of Jody Vipperman Saarmaa and Erik Saarmaa, 2016.25.1.1 – 16

Ed Ruscha, Born in Omaha, Nebraska, 1937, Parking Lots, 1967 (printed 1999). Portfolio of 30 photographs, Printed text on paper and gelatin silver prints, Edition 26/35, 14 15/16 x 14 15/16 inches (37.9 x 37.9 cm) each. Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.27.1 – 30

Thomas Scheibitz, Born in Radeberg, Germany, 1968, Springtime on Stage, 2004. Portfolio of 8 photographs, Chromogenic prints, 8 1/4 x 5 7/8 inches (21 x 14.9 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.28.A – G

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 1. Aktion Hochzeit (1st Action Marriage), 1965. Portfolio of 19 photographs, Gelatin silver prints, 2 1/4 x 2 3/16 inches (5.7 x 5.6 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.29.1 – 6; 2017.4.30.1 – 2; 2017.4.38.1 – 10

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 2. Aktion (2nd Action), 1965. Gelatin silver print, 11 1/2 x 15 1/2 inches (29.2 x 39.4 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.30.3

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 2. Aktion (2nd Action), 1965. Gelatin silver print, 11 1/2 x 15 1/2 inches (29.2 x 39.4 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.30.4

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 3. Aktion (3rd Action), 1965. Gelatin silver print, 15 1/2 x 11 3/4 inches (39.4 x 29.8 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.30.5

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 4. Aktion (4th Action), 1965. Gelatin silver print, 13 3/8 x 13 3/8 inches (34 x 34 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.30.6

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 4. Aktion (4th Action), 1965. Gelatin silver print, 13 3/8 x 13 3/8 inches (34 x 34 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.30.7

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 4. Aktion (4th Action), 1965. Gelatin silver print, 13 3/8 x 13 3/8 inches (34 x 34 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.30.8

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 5. Aktion (5th Action), 1965. Gelatin silver print, 15 1/2 x 11 5/8 inches (39.4 x 29.5 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.30.9

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 6. Aktion (6th Action), 1966. Gelatin silver print, 13 3/8 x 13 3/8 inches (34 x 34 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.30.10

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 6. Aktion (6th Action), 1966. Gelatin silver print, 13 x 13 1/16 inches (33 x 33.2 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.30.11

Rudolf Schwarzkogler, Born in Vienna, Austria, 1940, 6. Aktion (6th Action), 1966. Gelatin silver print, 11 5/8 x 15 1/2 inches (29.5 x 39.4 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.30.12

David Benjamin Sherry, Born in Woodstock, New York, 1981, All Matterings of Mind Equal One Violet, 2011. Chromogenic print mounted on aluminum, Edition 1/3, 72 × 91 1/2 inches (182.9 × 232.4 cm). Gift of Katherine and Terrance Kerr, 2016.14.1

America Coming Together (ACT): The 2004 Election Benefit Print Series, 2004, Portfolio of 10 works on paper by John Baldessari, Cecily Brown, Frank O. Gehry, Jasper Johns, Ellsworth Kelly, Elizabeth Murray, Robert Rauschenberg, Susan Rothernberg, Ed Rushca, and Richard Serra. Mediums variable, Edition 70/165, Dimensions variable. Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.2.1 – 10

John James Audubon, American, 1785 – 1851, Birds of America, 1826 – 1838. Double elephant folio edition of 103 prints, Hand‑colored engravings with aquatint and etching on paper, Dimensions variable. Gift of the Richard B. Anderson Family Foundation, 2016.9.1 – 103

Bruce Conner, Born in McPherson, Kansas, 1933 – 2008, MANDALA SET OF SIX, 1965. Portfolio of 6 prints, Offset lithographs on paper, Edition 2/50, 19 1/2 x 19 1/2 inches (49.5 x 49.5 cm). Gift of Kristine Stiles in honor of Richard Brodhead, 2016.8.1.1 – 6

Jim Dine, Born in Cincinnati, Ohio, 1935, A Robe in Los Angeles, 1984. Lithograph on Arches paper, Edition 10/50, 53 7/8 × 35 inches (136.8 × 88.9 cm). Gift of Trent A. Carmichael, 2016.22.1

Rev. Howard Finster, Born in Valley Head, Alabama, 1916 – 2001, Citys of Gold. Lithograph on paper, Edition 78/200, 18 3/4 x 14 1/8 inches (47.6 x 35.9 cm). Gift of Bruce Lineker, T’86, 2016.7.3

The Geldzahler Portfolio, 1998, Portfolio of 11 works by David Hockney, Roy Lichtenstein, Frank Stella, David Salle, Jasper Johns, James Rosenquist, Louise Bourgeois, Dennis Hopper, Francesco Clemente, Ellsworth Kelly, and Andy Warhol. Mediums variable, Dimensions variable. Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.6.1 – 11

Michael Jenkins, Born in Savannah, Georgia, 1957, Life Guard Tower, n.d. Graphite and oil on paper, 64 x 40 inches (162.6 x 101.6 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.17

Jasper Johns, Born in Augusta, Georgia, 1930, Figure 6, 1975. Etching on paper, Trial proof, 9 1/2 x 6 7/8 inches (24.1 x 17.5 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.18

Ray Johnson, Born in Detroit, Michigan, 1927 – 1995, Untitled (Blue Dotted Swiss Fabric over Utopia Parkway), 1991. Mixed media collage, 10 3/4 x 7 3/8 inches (27.3 x 18.7 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.19

Manuel Neri, Born in Sanger, California, 1930, She Said Series No. 6, 1990. Water‑based pigments and charcoal on paper, 39 5/8 × 26 1/4 inches (100.6 × 66.7 cm). Gift of the Manuel Neri Trust, 2016.26.5

Reynaldo Olivares, Born in Mexico, 1947, Ayuda a Chiapas, n.d. Linocut on paper, 19 7/8 × 25 3/4 inches (50.5 × 65.4 cm). Gift of Robert G. Rosenthal and Beth R. Friedland, 2016.27.1

Reynaldo Olivares, Born in Mexico, 1947, Marcos, n.d. Linocut on paper, 19 7/8 × 25 5/8 inches (50.5 × 65.1 cm). Gift of Robert G. Rosenthal and Beth R. Friedland, 2016.27.2

Reynaldo Olivares, Born in Mexico, 1947, Untitled, n.d. Linocut on paper, 18 × 21 3/8 inches (45.7 × 54.3 cm). Gift of Robert G. Rosenthal and Beth R. Friedland, 2016.27.3

Reynaldo Olivares, Born in Mexico, 1947, Zapata, n.d. Linocut on paper, 19 3/4 × 25 1/2 inches (50.2 × 64.8 cm). Gift of Robert G. Rosenthal and Beth R. Friedland, 2016.27.4

Reynaldo Olivares, Born in Mexico, 1947, Presagio, n.d. Linocut on paper, 11 3/4 × 25 5/8 inches (29.8 × 65.1 cm). Gift of Robert G. Rosenthal and Beth R. Friedland, 2016.27.5

Raymond Pettibon, Born in Tucson, Arizona, 1957, Jots and Tittles, 1998. Portfolio of 12 lithographs, Hand‑colored lithographs on paper, Edition 3/12, Dimensions variable. Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.24.1 – 12

Raymond Pettibon, Born in Tucson, Arizona, 1957, Untitled, 2002, Screenprint on paper, Edition 60/100, 32 1/2 x 24 1/2 x 1 1/4 inches (82.6 x 62.2 x 3.2 cm), Gift of Bruce Lineker, T’86, 2017.6.2

Gary Simmons, Born in New York, New York, 1964, Untitled (Blackboard Drawing), n.d. Crayon and chalk on paper, Left: 8 7/8 x 5 7/8 inches (22.5 x 14.9 cm), Right: 8 7/8 x 5 7/8 inches (22.5 x 14.9 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.33

Pat Steir, Born in Newark, New Jersey, 1940, John Yau, Born in Lynn, Massachusetts, 1950, Rain Pillow (Red/Gold), 2000. Lithograph on paper, Edition 15/20, 24 x 22 1/2 x 1 1/2 inches (61 x 57.2 x 3.8 cm). Gift of Bruce Lineker, T’86, 2017.6.3

Hiroshi Sugimoto, Born in Tokyo, Japan, 1948, Time Exposed, 1980 (printed 1991). Portfolio of 50 offset lithographs, Offset lithographs on paper, Edition of 500, 14 x 18 1/4 inches (35.6 x 46.4 cm) each. Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, 2017.4.34.1 – 50

Kehinde Wiley, Born in Los Angeles, California, 1977, Study for Ivelaw III, 2006. Pencil and oil on paper, 27 1/2 x 21 1/2 inches (69.9 x 54.6 cm). Gift of Blake Byrne, T’57, in honor of Raymond D. Nasher, 2017.4.36

Hale Woodruff, Born in Cairo, Illinois, 1900 – 1980, Selections from the Atlanta Period, 1931–1946 (printed 1996). Portfolio of 8 prints, Linocuts on chine collé papier d’Arches, Edition 42/75. Museum purchase and partial gift of Auldlyn Higgins Williams and E.T. Williams, Jr., of New York in memory of Anthony Drexel Duke, Sr., 2016.17.1.1 – 7
